step1.para: Remove all carbon from valve stems and heads using a wire brush.
Inspect each valve, replacing any that show evidence of burn marks, warping, scuffing, bending, or valve tip spalling.

Measure each valve stem diameter for wear using a 0-1 inch micrometer. Record readings. Measure valves at three locations 90° apart. Replace any valves that exceed the minimum stem diameter specification. See Specifications.

note.para: The intake valve has a larger diameter head.

step1.para: Using the valve guide inside diameters measured earlier and the valve stem diameter measurements just recorded, determine valve stem-to-guide running clearance. Replace valve or cylinder head as required. See Specifications.
Measure the valve face margin at four locations (90° apart) using a dial caliper.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, the minimum valve face margin must be maintained across the entire valve face. An insufficient margin will not provide proper heat dissipation and lead to valve warping or breakage. Intake and exhaust valve margins are different. Replace valve if the margin is less than the specified minimum. See Specifications.

note.para: If valves and seats are in a serviceable condition, they may be re-faced to the specified angles. See Specifications.
